name: Jollof Rice
description: A one-pot dish with rice, tomatoes, and spices, often served at parties.
instructions: 1. Rinse the rice. 2. Saut√© onions and peppers. 3. Add tomatoes and spices, then the rice. 4. Cook until rice is tender.

name: Bunny Chow
description: A South African street food consisting of a hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with curry.
instructions: 1. Prepare curry. 2. Hollow out bread. 3. Fill with curry. 4. Serve hot.

name: Injera
description: A sourdough flatbread used as a base for various dishes, often served with stews.
instructions: 1. Mix teff flour with water and yeast. 2. Let batter ferment. 3. Cook on a hot pan until bubbles form.

name: Tagine
description: A slow-cooked stew made in a special earthenware pot, often flavored with spices.
instructions: 1. Brown meat. 2. Add vegetables and spices. 3. Simmer in tagine pot until tender.

name: Fufu
description: A starchy side dish made by boiling and pounding root vegetables.
instructions: 1. Boil cassava and plantains. 2. Mash until smooth. 3. Serve with soup or stew.
